page.title: 06ST.MARYS CHURCH.
page.content: THE CHURCH,ST.MARYS VALENCE IS KNOWN TO HAVE EXISTED IN 1314.IT WAS STRUCK BY LIGHTNING IN 1794 AND WAS BURNED DOWN.THE TOWER WAS ALTERED IN 1850. THE FRESCOES WERE PAINTED BY MISS SHARPE OF UFTON NERVET.THERE ARE SOME VERY OLD AND INTERESTING GRAVESTONES BESIDE THE CHURCH PORCH.A ONE TIME VICAR THOS.STACKHOUSE WROTE A HISTORY OF THE BIBLE BUT WAS BEST KNOWN FOR HIS SAT. NIGHT SOJOURN IN JACK'S BOOTH FOLLOWED BY HIS SERMONS ON THE EVILS OF DRINK ON THE SUNDAY.GREAT EFFORTS ARE BEING MADE TO RAISE THE SUM OF Â£40,000 TO EFFECT REPAIRS TO THE ROOF AND TOWER.THE VIEW FROM THE TOWER OVER THE SURROUNDING COUNTRYSIDE IS WORTH THE CLIMB. THE LOCAL PUBLIC HOUSE "THE SIX BELLS"IS SUPPOSED TO TAKE ITS NAME FROM THE SIX BELLS OF THE CHURCH.
